org.gwt.mosaic.ui.client
Class TabLayoutPanel

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
          com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Composite
              org.gwt.mosaic.ui.client.LayoutComposite
                  org.gwt.mosaic.ui.client.TabLayoutPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IndexedPanel, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.SourcesTabEvents, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.TabListener, java.lang.Iterable<com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget>, HasLayoutManager
Direct Known Subclasses:
DecoratedTabLayoutPanel
public class TabLayoutPanel
extends LayoutComposite
implements com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.TabListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.SourcesTabEvents, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IndexedPanel

A LayoutPanel that represents a tabbed set of pages, each of which contains another widget. Its child widgets are shown as the user selects the various tabs associated with them.

CSS Style Rules

  • .mosaic-TabLayoutPanel { the tab layout panel itself }
  • .mosaic-TabLayoutPanelBottom { the bottom section of the tab layout panel (the deck containing the widget) }

Author:
georgopoulos.georgios(at)gmail.com

insert

public void insert(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget widget,
                   java.lang.String tabText,
                   boolean asHTML,
                   int beforeIndex)
Inserts a widget into the tab panel. If the Widget is already attached to the TabLayoutPanel, it will be moved to the requested index.

Parameters:
widget - the widget to be inserted
tabText - the text to be shown on its tab
asHTML - true to treat the specified text as HTML
beforeIndex - the index before which it will be inserted
